creator: jesse.glick@netbeans.com
text:
If you have a JAR with no files:

<jar manifest="..." jarfile="..."/>

it is never considered up-to-date, even if the manifest does not change and the
target *.jar is left alone. This is in 1.4.1 and I think current dev version.
Regression from 1.3 in which this worked: the JAR would not be recreated, and no
message printed, unless the manifest changed.

Attaching simple sample case, and suggested patch which appears to work (only
tested lightly).

Perhaps this could be included in unit tests?

creator: jesse.glick@netbeans.com
text:
Created attachment 1082
Sample test case - run twice in a row; ZIP file
